1. Based on certain sources:

    I feel that Jiang Qing did have genuine feelings for Mao. As a figure who has long been politically stereotyped… it’s somewhat unexpected, yet also reasonable.

    Before 1961, Jiang Qing indeed appeared to care deeply about whether Mao loved herâ€”her entire mental state and social position were profoundly tied to whether she was “loved by Mao.” If it were merely a transaction, it would probably be manageable. It seems that the fundamental driving force behind many things still has to be emotion (ğŸ˜‚).
